title: WHIRLING / BATHROOM MIRROR
description: A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall, above a bent and broken sink.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "An old mirror hangs on the wall. Yo..."
dialogueTree.text: An old mirror hangs on the wall. You see the reflection of your face in it -- such as it is. A regular clean-shaven police officer.

links.title: Endurance: "It's time. Time to see yourself as..."
links.text: It's time. Time to see yourself as you truly are. It's going to be absolutely *devastating*, but there's no way to avoid it.

links.title: Endurance: "This idiocy has gone on far too lon..."
links.text: This idiocy has gone on far too long. It's time to wipe that decadent homo-sexual grin off your face. Time to see yourself as you truly are.

links.title: You: "Face yourself."
links.text: Face yourself.

links.title: Endurance: "It's time you knew the truth, bröth..."
links.text: It's time you knew the truth, bröther.

links.title: You: "I am ready."
links.text: I am ready.

links.title: Endurance: "Love... time... Revachol..."
links.text: Love... time... Revachol...

links.title: Endurance: "It's all shit."
links.text: It's all shit.

links.title: You: "All of it?"
links.text: All of it?

links.title: Endurance: "*All* of it."
links.text: *All* of it.

links.title: You: "Even love?"
links.text: Even love?

links.title: Endurance: "Especially love, bröther. Face it,..."
links.text: Especially love, bröther. Face it, no one's willing to make the sacrifices that are necessary, not in this day and age.

links.title: Endurance: "Look deep inside yourself. You know..."
links.text: Look deep inside yourself. You know it's true, because it *hurts*.

links.title: You: "I may as well give up then..."
links.text: I may as well give up then...

links.title: Endurance: "Who said anything about giving up?"
links.text: Who said anything about giving up?

links.title: Endurance: "It takes a true kingsman to summon..."
links.text: It takes a true kingsman to summon the *will* to face reality in all its darkness. To stare straight into the abyss and do *what must be done*.

links.title: You: "I will bear any burthen."
links.text: I will bear any burthen.

links.title: Endurance: "There's a lever in front of you. Pu..."
links.text: There's a lever in front of you. Pull it, and atomic fire blankets your beloved Revachol. Millions die in an instant. But you are spared. You, and the voice in the payphone.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "That voice... so warm and sweet..."
links.text: That voice... so warm and sweet...

links.title: Inland Empire: "No-no, not the voice! Make it stop...."
links.text: No-no, not the voice! Make it stop...

links.title: Endurance: "While the world burns, the two of y..."
links.text: While the world burns, the two of you, together again, ride an aerostatic into the sunset. Maybe it will work this time? Spare Revachol and you'll never hear from her again. Will you sacrifice a second chance at love to keep Revachol safe?

links.title: Interfacing: "An involuntary twitch runs through..."
links.text: An involuntary twitch runs through your hand, almost like reflex.

links.title: You: "Wait, can Kim be in the aerostatic..."
links.text: Wait, can Kim be in the aerostatic too?

links.title: Endurance: "Fine... The three of you, all toget..."
links.text: Fine... The three of you, all together, ride an aerostatic into the sunset. The question remains: Will you sacrifice love to keep Revachol safe?

links.title: You: "Pull the imaginary lever."
links.text: Pull the imaginary lever.

links.title: Endurance: "You're a hard motherfucker... (Tigh..."
links.text: You're a hard motherfucker... (Tightness -- in gaseous form -- leaves your body.) If we didn't know better, we'd say you *enjoyed* consigning your city to the flames.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Nine million souls flicker out of e..."
links.text: Nine million souls flicker out of existence. Sixteen if you include the greater metropolitan area.

links.title: You: "(Bow down.) Yes. My heart forever b..."
links.text: (Bow down.) Yes. My heart forever beats for Revachol, I am all she has left. The constant kingsman.

links.title: Endurance: "Yes... you truly are. (Tightness --..."
links.text: Yes... you truly are. (Tightness -- in gaseous form -- leaves your body.) She's lucky to have you, watching her sleep.

links.title: Endurance: "Enough. The Franconigerian Court of..."
links.text: Enough. The Franconigerian Court of Honour has held your naked soul up against the Sevenfold Sun Miracle and looked right through it. Close your eyes and *know*, this is who you are:

links.title: Endurance: "*Nothing* -- not pain, fatigue, hun..."
links.text: *Nothing* -- not pain, fatigue, hunger, fear or desire -- will ever deviate you from the path. Like an icebreaker you crush all opposition, ploughing forward *no matter what it takes*.

links.title: Endurance: "Now open your eyes and witness the..."
links.text: Now open your eyes and witness the wonder! The HMS Last Kingsman has left the docks. The world will tremble as you smash all the ice in the world.

links.title: You: "Wait, what happened to my face?"
links.text: Wait, what happened to my face?

links.title: Endurance: "It was time to banish that pitiful,..."
links.text: It was time to banish that pitiful, *sad* look from your face -- and replace it with a perfect reflection of your unyielding resolve, your noble suffering.

links.title: Volition: "Maybe it will make you temptation-p..."
links.text: Maybe it will make you temptation-proof, so something good will come out of this at least?

links.title: Authority: "This is the face worn by the first..."
links.text: This is the face worn by the first law-bringers, the noble tyrants. Today you join their number...

links.title: Conceptualization: "You'll plough your way toward the f..."
links.text: You'll plough your way toward the frigid lands of Katla and Vaasa, smashing every ice sheet in your path. Nothing, *nothing* can stop an icebreaker...

links.title: Composure: "*Ahem*. It's a *lot* like the face..."
links.text: *Ahem*. It's a *lot* like the face on that rather unfortunate muscle-man t-shirt you just so happen to be wearing...

links.title: You: "Will I ever be able to make another..."
links.text: Will I ever be able to make another face again?

links.title: Endurance: "*Never*. May this serve as a consta..."
links.text: *Never*. May this serve as a constant reminder of your sacred, un-put-downable burthen.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "That's one way of saying that the n..."
links.text: That's one way of saying that the nerve damage is *quite* severe. The only way you'll be able to change your face now is with your fingers...

links.title: Composure: "*Ahem*. It's a *lot* like the face..."
links.text: *Ahem*. It's a *lot* like the face a certain muscle-man is making on that t-shirt you insist on carrying around...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "*Ahem*. It's *very* similar to the..."
links.text: *Ahem*. It's *very* similar to the face Hjelmdallermann is always making on the cover of those books...

links.title: Inland Empire: "You are a terror even to yourself!"
links.text: You are a terror even to yourself!

links.title: Endurance: "It was time to banish that ridiculo..."
links.text: It was time to banish that ridiculous *Expression* from your face -- and replace it with a perfect reflection of your unyielding resolve, your noble suffering.

links.title: You: "I will never forsake my vöws. (Conc..."
links.text: I will never forsake my vöws. (Conclude.)

links.title: Endurance: "Now shout from the top of your lung..."
links.text: Now shout from the top of your lungs: YOU ARE THE NOBLE SUFFERER.

links.title: Shivers: "In a rundown shack on the far coast..."
links.text: In a rundown shack on the far coast, a middle-aged man pounds his fist and looses an animal cry as he stares into a sliver of clouded glass...

links.title: Shivers: "From above the Bay of Revachol, a c..."
links.text: From above the Bay of Revachol, a cold wind gathers in response. The people of the fishing village pull their coats and blankets tight about themselves...

links.title: Shivers: "A cold damp seeps in through the ga..."
links.text: A cold damp seeps in through the gaps between the wall planks. There is no one to bear witness to your vow...

links.title: Mirror: "You step back from the mirror. A lo..."
links.text: You step back from the mirror. A loose board creaks.

links.title: Mirror: "You step back from the mirror. A be..."
links.text: You step back from the mirror. A bead of water drips from the pipe beneath the washbasin.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You used to believe you came from a..."
links.text: You used to believe you came from a large family with many half-brothers and sisters, but where are they now? However you shout, they can't hear you...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "In a mould-covered bathroom inside..."
links.text: In a mould-covered bathroom inside a trashed hostel near the edge of Martinaise, a middle-aged man grips the sides of a cold sink in white-knuckled fury...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Meanwhile, his colleague is filling..."
links.text: Meanwhile, his colleague is filling in the last clues of his nightly crossword when he hears what seems to be some kind of animalistic howling from the adjoining room. He directs his eyes toward the door of their shared bathroom...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He sets down the paper and quickly..."
links.text: He sets down the paper and quickly scribbles the date and time in his notebook, along with a note: 'HDB possible relapse? Check in first thing.'

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He sighs and returns to his crosswo..."
links.text: He sighs and returns to his crossword. He is a police officer, not a baby-sitter.

links.title: Endurance: "Despite doubt, fear, sentimentality..."
links.text: Despite doubt, fear, sentimentality and weakness, you plough ever forward, like an icebreaker, tearing through the frigid North Sea.

links.title: Endurance: "You're tired, afraid, sad, hungry a..."
links.text: You're tired, afraid, sad, hungry and in pain. But most of all: confused. Yet *still*, like a tiny icebreaker -- the tiniest boat in the fleet -- you plough ever forward...

links.title: Endurance: "Now open your eyes and witness the..."
links.text: Now open your eyes and witness the (small) wonder! The HMS Modest Kingsman has left the docks. You are neither the greatest nor the strongest icebreaker on the seas, but you are what you are.

links.title: Endurance: "Remember: Kingsmen are not born, th..."
links.text: Remember: Kingsmen are not born, they are made. And the only thing that can unmake us is that which drove us to rise above in the first place. We keep that thing locked in the deepest cellars of our mind. So deep we forget what it is.

links.title: Volition: "Does this thing *unmake* you, or do..."
links.text: Does this thing *unmake* you, or does it heal you?

links.title: Endurance: "We keep it buried like a horrible s..."
links.text: We keep it buried like a horrible secret. We feed it through the cracks in the floorboards out of a sickening sense of nostalgia. Just enough to keep it alive. And yet it still comes to us in moments of weakness, unbidden, a source of shame and panic...

links.title: Conceptualization: "This is a horrible allegory for......"
links.text: This is a horrible allegory for... whatever is on the other end.

links.title: Endurance: "A day will come when you need to ta..."
links.text: A day will come when you need to take a shotgun to that cellar, shoot whatever is down there in the head, and walk away, never looking back.

links.title: You: "Wait, why do I need to do that?"
links.text: Wait, why do I need to do that?

links.title: Endurance: "Your heart can belong to Revachol o..."
links.text: Your heart can belong to Revachol or it can belong to darkness. As long as it's torn between them it's broken and useless.

links.title: You: "What happens to me then?"
links.text: What happens to me then?

links.title: Endurance: "You will be free to love Revachol l..."
links.text: You will be free to love Revachol like no one has ever loved her. You will be her champion, and she will be *faithful* to you. If you can just make this last sacrifice, you will *finally* know happiness.

links.title: Endurance: "So ask yourself, when the time come..."
links.text: So ask yourself, when the time comes, can you shoot the past in the head, walk away, and never look back on its rotting remains?

links.title: You: "I don't think I can do that."
links.text: I don't think I can do that.

links.title: Endurance: "You haven't yet banished all weakne..."
links.text: You haven't yet banished all weakness, but you will. We know you will...

links.title: You: "(Rack the imaginary shotgun.) Whate..."
links.text: (Rack the imaginary shotgun.) Whatever it takes. For *Revachol*.

links.title: Endurance: "The bloated whores, schizophrenic a..."
links.text: The bloated whores, schizophrenic anarchists and deformed moneylenders tremble, trying to shield their eyes, as he -- *Le gendarme en diamant* -- walks by!

links.title: You: "How do I know I'm a true kingsman?"
links.text: How do I know I'm a true kingsman?

links.title: You: "I won't give up. I *can't* give up."
links.text: I won't give up. I *can't* give up.

links.title: You: "What's going on? I thought I *succe..."
links.text: What's going on? I thought I *succeeded*!

links.title: Endurance: "Bröther. You *have* succeeded..."
links.text: Bröther. You *have* succeeded...

links.title: You: "How dare you speak of Revachol that..."
links.text: How dare you speak of Revachol that way...

links.title: Endurance: "Face it, bröther. No one's got the..."
links.text: Face it, bröther. No one's got the *willpower* to build her up again. They won't do what has to be done.

links.title: You: "You're wrong. There's still a way t..."
links.text: You're wrong. There's still a way to turn back time. To make things *richtig*.

links.title: Endurance: "Face it, bröther. No one's got the..."
links.text: Face it, bröther. No one's got the *willpower* to set things right. They won't do what it takes.

links.title: You: "It can't be."
links.text: It can't be.

links.title: Endurance: "It can, and it *is*. Just a mountai..."
links.text: It can, and it *is*. Just a mountain of shit, every bit of it.

links.title: Endurance: "What was *that*? Did you just *flin..."
links.text: What was *that*? Did you just *flinch* before your own reflection?

links.title: You: "I did not."
links.text: I did not.

links.title: Endurance: "Yes, you did. There's no use denyin..."
links.text: Yes, you did. There's no use denying it...

links.title: You: "It was just a reflex!"
links.text: It was just a reflex!

links.title: Endurance: "The problem is obvious: You simply..."
links.text: The problem is obvious: You simply can't hack it. You're a failure. It's all *too much* for you.

links.title: You: "But I was trying so hard! I was mak..."
links.text: But I was trying so hard! I was making progress!

links.title: Endurance: "It wasn't enough. You simply don't..."
links.text: It wasn't enough. You simply don't have what it *takes*...

links.title: Endurance: "Look at yourself: You go about with..."
links.text: Look at yourself: You go about with this mopey look on your face like a dog who's been beaten with an old stick.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Hey! It took a minor neurological *..."
links.text: Hey! It took a minor neurological *miracle* to get your face to this point!

links.title: Endurance: "You've let your guard down. Now the..."
links.text: You've let your guard down. Now the combined armies of Pain and Shit are streaming through your gates, pillaging your stores, carrying off your wömen...

links.title: Endurance: "That stupid *Expression* was your l..."
links.text: That stupid *Expression* was your last line of defence, but now even that has collapsed. The combined armies of Pain and Shit are streaming through your gates, pillaging your stores, carrying off your wömen...

links.title: You: "No, not the stores..."
links.text: No, not the stores...

links.title: Endurance: "Oh yes, they're all *wiped out*. Yo..."
links.text: Oh yes, they're all *wiped out*. Your bushels of grain, your salted meats, your hogsheads brimming with bitter ale. All gone. Your fields have been put to the torch, your great-hall is a ravaged husk. You are bereft.

links.title: Endurance: "And that doesn't even *begin* to co..."
links.text: And that doesn't even *begin* to cover what's happened to your wömen...

links.title: You: "Goddamnit..."
links.text: Goddamnit...

links.title: You: "Oh no..."
links.text: Oh no...

links.title: You: "Not my wömen..."
links.text: Not my wömen...

links.title: Endurance: "Oh yes, they're all gone. Carried o..."
links.text: Oh yes, they're all gone. Carried off by foreign invaders because you failed to uphold your most ancient and noble vöws. The worst part is they might even *prefer* it this way...

links.title: Endurance: "Now, every night, while you masturb..."
links.text: Now, every night, while you masturbate in the ruins of your not-so-great-anymore hall, they're getting pleasured by foreign men with superior testosterone levels and *far* more advanced sexual practices than your feeble grunt-and-thrust.

links.title: You: "Hold on, my cocksmanship is on par..."
links.text: Hold on, my cocksmanship is on par with...!

links.title: Endurance: "What's that? Can't hear yourself ov..."
links.text: What's that? Can't hear yourself over the moans of your wömen in the hands of foreigners who play them like instruments. Be careful, or they'll wear you like a sock, Harry-boy.

links.title: You: "God, does it have to be so awful?"
links.text: God, does it have to be so awful?

links.title: Endurance: "Yes. It *should* be awful, because..."
links.text: Yes. It *should* be awful, because you failed. Failing is weakness and weakness is awful. That is the way of the world...

links.title: Endurance: "It turns out you've already been we..."
links.text: It turns out you've already been wearing your *true* face. The face of The Loser. The face of He Who Could Not Handle It. Now, get out of your sight.

links.title: Endurance: "Let this new face be a reminder, an..."
links.text: Let this new face be a reminder, an unalterable mark of shame. This is the face of The Loser, the face of He Who Looks at Himself and Despairs. Now, get out of your sight.

links.title: You: "It's never not too late! I can *sti..."
links.text: It's never not too late! I can *still* turn it back...

links.title: Endurance: "No, it's *far* too late. All that r..."
links.text: No, it's *far* too late. All that remains is for you to feel bad, because you failed, and there's nothing you can do about it. That is the way of the world...

links.title: You: "Accept your fate with quiet resigna..."
links.text: Accept your fate with quiet resignation.

links.title: Endurance: "You don't even have anything to say..."
links.text: You don't even have anything to say for yourself, do you? Just gonna take it all lying down? Why not grab your ankles while you're at it? That's why you never stood a chance.

links.title: You: "What's too much?"
links.text: What's too much?

links.title: Endurance: "Love... time... Revachol... all of..."
links.text: Love... time... Revachol... all of it. The pressure is putting you on your knees.

links.title: You: "Dig deep into your mind to locate t..."
links.text: Dig deep into your mind to locate the source of *The Expression*.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It belongs in The New -- the third..."
links.text: It belongs in The New -- the third decade of the current century. Enough time had passed from the failure of Revolution that, for a fleeting moment, free market economy seemed like the ultimate, uncontested way of life for our species.

links.title: You: "Okay..."
links.text: Okay...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Things were good. It was *smooth sa..."
links.text: Things were good. It was *smooth sailing*. People made gold-and-champagne-tinted interiors and façades to suit the times, calling this *The New Style*. But, more importantly -- disco happened.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "For Revachol -- your city -- that m..."
links.text: For Revachol -- your city -- that meant only one thing: Guillaume Le Million!

links.title: Drama: "If it doesn't rhyme, you're not pro..."
links.text: If it doesn't rhyme, you're not pronouncing it right.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Out of the dazzling swirl of disco..."
links.text: Out of the dazzling swirl of disco music, in an open air *boîte de nuit* somewhere in Revachol West, Guillaume's blond mane appeared on the screen. He sang some bullshit. Then he made *The Expression*.

links.title: You: "So I adopted it? Why?"
links.text: So I adopted it? Why?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Everyone loved it. Maybe you though..."
links.text: Everyone loved it. Maybe you thought some of the stardust would rub off on you? Maybe it did? Either way, it's all gone now. Only the grimace remains.

links.title: You: "I feel the need to add a clicking s..."
links.text: I feel the need to add a clicking sound when I make it: *Click-click*.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The click is used to spur on a hors..."
links.text: The click is used to spur on a horse. It also features heavily in Guillaume Le Million's regional mega-hit "Don't Worry (Your Pretty Little Head)".

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Sometimes you like to add finger pi..."
links.text: Sometimes you like to add finger pistols to the mix, because unlike Guillaume le Million you are a police officer. It's your nifty little way to say: I'm armed and dangerous.

links.title: You: "How long ago was The New?"
links.text: How long ago was The New?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "There is a vast ocean of time betwe..."
links.text: There is a vast ocean of time between right now and *The Expression* looking good on you -- or anyone. Two decades, if the calendar is to be trusted. Humanity has run aground in that time, it's a different world now. The Expression is a relic.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Some twenty odd years. There is a v..."
links.text: Some twenty odd years. There is a vast ocean of time between right now and *The Expression* looking good on you -- or anyone. Humanity has run aground in that time, it's a different world now. The Expression is a relic.

links.title: You: "Anything else? Like who am I? Why d..."
links.text: Anything else? Like who am I? Why did I drink myself into oblivion?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You have some understanding of the..."
links.text: You have some understanding of the near history of disco, plus the trivia you've picked up along the way. Episodic memory, however, remains in the dark. It may never return. You should prepare yourself for that.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You have some understanding of the..."
links.text: You have some understanding of the recent history of disco. The rest is darkness.

links.title: You: "Does this have anything to do with..."
links.text: Does this have anything to do with Ostentatious Orchestrations?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Not really. OO must have just stirr..."
links.text: Not really. OO must have just stirred your mind. They're more like a disco rock band anyway...

links.title: You: "I guess that's it then. (Conclude.)"
links.text: I guess that's it then. (Conclude.)

links.title: Mirror: "It doesn't have to be. You can swoo..."
links.text: It doesn't have to be. You can swoon over Guillaume and his champagne-cork smile whenever you want to... Maybe some of the stardust will return?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Like the rest of you, it comes from..."
links.text: Like the rest of you, it comes from a bad place somewhere in the past. That's all you know for now.

links.title: You: "Attempt to stop *The Expression* fr..."
links.text: Attempt to stop *The Expression* from happening.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "It's like something snaps in you --..."
links.text: It's like something snaps in you -- a nerve ending, a thought, a sadness. Your face in the mirror is suddenly clean of the leer that had distorted it for god knows how long.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Just like that it's over -- the run..."
links.text: Just like that it's over -- the running gag that your life had become. A sad old man looks back at you.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "It's like something snaps in you --..."
links.text: It's like something snaps in you -- a nerve ending, a thought, a sadness. Your face in the mirror is suddenly clean of the leer that had distorted it. For god knows how long...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Still not happening. It won't come..."
links.text: Still not happening. It won't come off that easy.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "It's too late. Like an image on fil..."
links.text: It's too late. Like an image on film, *The Expression* belongs to your primary motor cortex. It would take a minor neurological miracle for you to cease producing it.

links.title: You: "Use your chaincutters to fix the fa..."
links.text: Use your chaincutters to fix the faucet. Stop steam from fogging up the mirror.

links.title: Interfacing: "The faucet is quite terribly mangle..."
links.text: The faucet is quite terribly mangled, but you just might be able to twist its parts into place.

links.title: Interfacing: "You handle the chaincutters deftly,..."
links.text: You handle the chaincutters deftly, applying just enough pressure. The faucet regains a recognizable shape. The steam stops.

links.title: Interfacing: "Told you that you *needed* those ch..."
links.text: Told you that you *needed* those chaincutters. Everything is connected. Everything has a purpose.

links.title: Mirror: "The mirror begins to clear slowly w..."
links.text: The mirror begins to clear slowly without you having to wipe it.

links.title: Interfacing: "Told you that you *needed* those ch..."
links.text: Told you that you *needed* those chaincutters. Everything is connected. Everything has a purpose.

links.title: Interfacing: "Your hands, however skilful, can't..."
links.text: Your hands, however skilful, can't manage this task on their own. You should get your chaincutters out.

links.title: Interfacing: "The chaincutters slip out of your h..."
links.text: The chaincutters slip out of your hands as you attempt to twist the faucet into place. Well, you know one thing for sure -- you've probably never been a plumber.

links.title: You: "[Let the mirror be for now.]"
links.text: [Let the mirror be for now.]

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "An old mirror hangs on the wall. Yo..."
dialogueTree.text: An old mirror hangs on the wall. You see the reflection of your face in it -- such as it is without *The Expression*. It's just hairy.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "An old mirror hangs on the wall. Yo..."
dialogueTree.text: An old mirror hangs on the wall. You see your reflection in it -- *The Expression* fixed to your clean-shaven face. You're still not accustomed to it.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "An old mirror hangs on the wall. Yo..."
dialogueTree.text: An old mirror hangs on the wall. You see the reflection of your face in it -- adorned with *The Expression*.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "An old mirror hangs on the wall, ha..."
dialogueTree.text: An old mirror hangs on the wall, half-covered in shadows. You cannot see yourself fully, just the outline of a man. You have no memory of the face that awaits you there.

links.title: You: "Really? Nothing?"
links.text: Really? Nothing?

links.title: Mirror: "Really -- all recollection of the p..."
links.text: Really -- all recollection of the person you are, the people in your life and even the world you're in has drowned in a sea of blood alcohol. This was no mere night of drinking, it was a deluge. Of world-ending proportions.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "With all the synapses you extinguis..."
links.text: With all the synapses you extinguished, it's a miracle you can even think this sentence. You've interrupted a true act of self-annulment here.

links.title: You: "Wipe the mirror."
links.text: Wipe the mirror.

links.title: Mirror: "As you slowly reach your hand towar..."
links.text: As you slowly reach your hand toward the surface of the mirror...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Abort! You clearly have not thought..."
links.text: Abort! You clearly have not thought this through. You won't like what you will see there -- and you will never *un-become* it.

links.title: You: "I don't care. (Still wipe the mirro..."
links.text: I don't care. (Still wipe the mirror.)

links.title: Mirror: "Behold!"
links.text: Behold!

links.title: Mirror: "You have no idea who this *thing* i..."
links.text: You have no idea who this *thing* is, do you?

links.title: You: "Dear lord help me, what is this?!"
links.text: Dear lord help me, what is this?!

links.title: Mirror: "Whatever it is, at least it's dead..."
links.text: Whatever it is, at least it's dead now. There's clearly rigor mortis on your face. Or wait... is that an *expression*? Are you trying to make an expression with that face?

links.title: You: "I think it might be because I'm a s..."
links.text: I think it might be because I'm a superstar.

links.title: Mirror: "Please stop, it's horrible! You're..."
links.text: Please stop, it's horrible! You're scaring yourself.

links.title: Volition: "You couldn't stop if you wanted to...."
links.text: You couldn't stop if you wanted to. It's neurological.

links.title: You: "Okay. (Try to stop.)"
links.text: Okay. (Try to stop.)

links.title: Mirror: "Oh my god, you *can't* stop! It's l..."
links.text: Oh my god, you *can't* stop! It's like it's not even voluntary anymore! You have worn that grin into your face and now it won't come off...

links.title: Mirror: "What does it even *mean*? What is t..."
links.text: What does it even *mean*? What is the emotion you're trying to convey?

links.title: You: "Superstardom."
links.text: Superstardom.

links.title: Mirror: "You should check yourself for a pul..."
links.text: You should check yourself for a pulse, superstar. From here it looks like a cadaverous spasm.

links.title: Mirror: "You should check yourself for a pul..."
links.text: You should check yourself for a pulse, superstar. From here it looks like a cadaverous spasm.

links.title: You: "God, I don't know -- it's indescrib..."
links.text: God, I don't know -- it's indescribable.

links.title: Mirror: "You should check yourself for a pul..."
links.text: You should check yourself for a pulse, because from here it looks like a cadaverous spasm.

links.title: You: "Check for pulse."
links.text: Check for pulse.

links.title: Mirror: "You find no sign of life on your sw..."
links.text: You find no sign of life on your swollen neck. However, putting your hand on your chest reveals an irregular heartbeat. You appear to be alive -- for now.

links.title: You: "I don't need to. I almost died tryi..."
links.text: I don't need to. I almost died trying to get that tie, but I heard my heart beat.

links.title: Mirror: "Getting clever appears to make *The..."
links.text: Getting clever appears to make *The Expression* even worse. Now it's mixed with smugness.

links.title: You: "I don't want to know."
links.text: I don't want to know.

links.title: Mirror: "Good call. Go ahead and try somethi..."
links.text: Good call. Go ahead and try something, if you like. Or -- you know -- stop staring into the mirror.

links.title: You: "I think it's supposed to look *sugg..."
links.text: I think it's supposed to look *suggestive*. I'm afraid it's meant *for the ladies*.

links.title: Mirror: "Please promise yourself you are not..."
links.text: Please promise yourself you are not going to try it on any of the *ladies*, whatever happens.

links.title: You: "I promise."
links.text: I promise.

links.title: Mirror: "You liar. You can't even tell the t..."
links.text: You liar. You can't even tell the truth to yourself. Go ahead, try something!

links.title: You: "I promise. (Lie.)"
links.text: I promise. (Lie.)

links.title: You: "No one tells me what to do."
links.text: No one tells me what to do.

links.title: Mirror: "That's right! Not even yourself. Go..."
links.text: That's right! Not even yourself. Go ahead, try something, it's not an order.

links.title: You: "I'm insinuating that I'm vaguely sy..."
links.text: I'm insinuating that I'm vaguely sympathetic. I think I'm sort of pulling it off too -- in a *sad has-been* kind of way. There is some charm to it.

links.title: Mirror: "There might have been. Ten years ag..."
links.text: There might have been. Ten years ago. It's little more than a cadaverous spasm now.

links.title: Endurance: "Have you really been wearing that d..."
links.text: Have you really been wearing that decadent homo-sexual grin this whole time? It's disgusting. No wonder you haven't been able to *truly face yourself*.

links.title: You: "It's an expression of pain."
links.text: It's an expression of pain.

links.title: Mirror: "You are correct."
links.text: You are correct.

links.title: You: "No. (Keep making the face.)"
links.text: No. (Keep making the face.)

links.title: Mirror: "You *can't*, can you? It's like it'..."
links.text: You *can't*, can you? It's like it's not even voluntary anymore. You have worn that grin into your face and now it won't come *off*...

links.title: You: "No, this is what superstars do. (Ke..."
links.text: No, this is what superstars do. (Keep making the face.)

links.title: You: "Actually, I'm not sure I *can* stop..."
links.text: Actually, I'm not sure I *can* stop.

links.title: Mirror: "No. That would be too insane."
links.text: No. That would be too insane.

links.title: You: "I'm pretty sure I can't stop."
links.text: I'm pretty sure I can't stop.

links.title: Mirror: "Oh my god, you're right! It's like..."
links.text: Oh my god, you're right! It's like it's not even voluntary anymore. You have worn that grin into your face and now it won't come *off*...

links.title: You: "I can try to. (Try to stop.)"
links.text: I can try to. (Try to stop.)

links.title: You: "If I can't stop, I wouldn't want to..."
links.text: If I can't stop, I wouldn't want to know. Better to just keep making it.

links.title: Mirror: "Maybe that's how it started? And no..."
links.text: Maybe that's how it started? And now it doesn't even matter anymore -- you've worn that grin into your face and it will never come *off*...

links.title: You: "I'm not making it, the face is maki..."
links.text: I'm not making it, the face is making it itself.

links.title: You: "I have no idea why it's there. It j..."
links.text: I have no idea why it's there. It just is.

links.title: You: "Of course I do. It's... uhm... is i..."
links.text: Of course I do. It's... uhm... is it some kind of superstar? I think I'm a superstar.

links.title: Mirror: "It appears you're also dead. There'..."
links.text: It appears you're also dead. There's clearly rigor mortis on your face, or wait... is that an *expression*? Are you trying to make an expression with that face? Why?

links.title: You: "This is the face of a late-stage al..."
links.text: This is the face of a late-stage alcoholic.

links.title: Mirror: "*Too* late. You clearly have rigor..."
links.text: *Too* late. You clearly have rigor mortis on your face, or wait... is that an *expression*? Are you trying to make an expression with that face? Why?

links.title: You: "Lets just get it over with. Wipe th..."
links.text: Lets just get it over with. Wipe the mirror.

links.title: You: "Maybe I should touch it first, make..."
links.text: Maybe I should touch it first, make sure there's nothing *wrong* with my face.

links.title: Mirror: "Yeah, there is definitely something..."
links.text: Yeah, there is definitely something wrong with it.

links.title: You: "What? What's wrong?"
links.text: What? What's wrong?

links.title: Mirror: "Where to even begin? There's the bl..."
links.text: Where to even begin? There's the bloatedness, then the swollenness... It's like there's an upholstery of alcohol underneath your skin.

links.title: You: "I'm sorry. (Touch your nose.)"
links.text: I'm sorry. (Touch your nose.)

links.title: Mirror: "Bet you are. Your nose feels like a..."
links.text: Bet you are. Your nose feels like a small balloon in the middle of your face. It hurts when you honk it, and it doesn't appear to be a particularly tiny nose either. Not with all the drinks it's *absorbed* for you.

links.title: You: "At least my tongue is okay. (Touch..."
links.text: At least my tongue is okay. (Touch your tongue.)

links.title: Mirror: "It's not. It's swollen and snail-li..."
links.text: It's not. It's swollen and snail-like, wriggling between your fingers.

links.title: You: "I'm scared. I want to stop doing th..."
links.text: I'm scared. I want to stop doing this.

links.title: Mirror: "Don't be scared. It's only your fac..."
links.text: Don't be scared. It's only your face. It's not like anyone is going to *see* it.

links.title: You: "Wipe the mirror now."
links.text: Wipe the mirror now.

links.title: You: "I'm outta here. [Leave.]"
links.text: I'm outta here. [Leave.]

links.title: You: "How bad could it be?"
links.text: How bad could it be?

links.title: You: "[Better not to know -- Leave.]"
links.text: [Better not to know -- Leave.]

links.title: You: "No way, I'm not doing this. [Back o..."
links.text: No way, I'm not doing this. [Back off.]

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "The bathroom mirror has been wiped..."
dialogueTree.text: The bathroom mirror has been wiped completely clean. You see the reflection of your face in the mirror -- such as it is. A regular, clean-shaven police officer.

links.title: Endurance: "It's time. Time to see yourself as..."
links.text: It's time. Time to see yourself as you truly are. It's going to be absolutely *devastating*, but there's no way to avoid it.

links.title: Endurance: "This idiocy has gone on too long. I..."
links.text: This idiocy has gone on too long. It's time to wipe that decadent homo-sexual grin off your face.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "The bathroom mirror has been wiped..."
dialogueTree.text: The bathroom mirror has been wiped completely clean. You see the reflection of your face in the mirror -- such as it is without *The Expression*. It's just hairy.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "The bathroom mirror has been wiped..."
dialogueTree.text: The bathroom mirror has been wiped completely clean. You see the reflection of yourself in the mirror -- *The Expression* fixed to your clean-shaven face. You're still not accustomed to it.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "The bathroom mirror has been wiped..."
dialogueTree.text: The bathroom mirror has been wiped completely clean. You see the reflection of your face in the mirror -- even now adorned with *The Expression*.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall..."
dialogueTree.text: A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall. It's barely covered in steam anymore. You see your face, such as it is. A regular, clean-shaven police officer.

links.title: Endurance: "It's time. Time to see yourself as..."
links.text: It's time. Time to see yourself as you truly are. It's going to be absolutely *devastating*, but there's no way to avoid it.

links.title: Endurance: "This idiocy has gone on too long. I..."
links.text: This idiocy has gone on too long. It's time to wipe that decadent homo-sexual grin off your face.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall..."
dialogueTree.text: A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall. It's barely covered in steam anymore. You see your face, such as it is without *The Expression*. It's just hairy.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall..."
dialogueTree.text: A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall. It's barely covered in steam anymore. You see yourself -- *The Expression* fixed to your clean-shaven face. You're still not accustomed to it.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall..."
dialogueTree.text: A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall. It's barely covered in steam anymore. It's your face in the mirror -- adorned with *The Expression*.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall..."
dialogueTree.text: A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall. In it -- your face, a regular, clean-shaven police officer.

links.title: Endurance: "It's time. Time to see yourself as..."
links.text: It's time. Time to see yourself as you truly are. It's going to be absolutely *devastating*, but there's no way to avoid it.

links.title: Endurance: "This idiocy has gone on too long. I..."
links.text: This idiocy has gone on too long. It's time to wipe that decadent homo-sexual grin off your face.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall..."
dialogueTree.text: A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall. In it -- your face, now without *The Expression*. It's just hairy.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall..."
dialogueTree.text: A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall. In it -- your clean-shaven face, adorned with *The Expression*. You're still not accustomed to it.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall..."
dialogueTree.text: A mirror hangs on the bathroom wall. In it -- your face, adorned with *The Expression*.

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "A mirror hangs on the wall, covered..."
dialogueTree.text: A mirror hangs on the wall, covered in steam. You cannot see yourself, just the outlines of a man. You have no memory of the face that awaits you there, underneath the soft vapour.

links.title: Endurance: "It's time. Your efforts at avoiding..."
links.text: It's time. Your efforts at avoiding this moment have been truly *heroic*, but now there's nothing left but for you to confront yourself as you *truly* are, no matter the consequences...

dialogueTree.title: Mirror: "A mirror hangs above a bent and bro..."
dialogueTree.text: A mirror hangs above a bent and broken sink. In a fierce discharge of masculine energy someone has ripped half the faucet off.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Was this not the same *élan* that f..."
links.text: Was this not the same *élan* that founds empires and lays waste to cities, virile, uncaring towards *the little things*?

links.title: Logic: "Probably not, no."
links.text: Probably not, no.

links.title: Mirror: "Hot water sprays from the base and..."
links.text: Hot water sprays from the base and steam covers the mirror. You cannot see yourself, just the outline of a man.

links.title: Mirror: "Suddenly you realise you have no me..."
links.text: Suddenly you realise you have no memory of the face that awaits you there, underneath the soft vapour.
